string-array.name: paraskeva
string-array.item: The Church of St Paraskeva is a Bulgarian Orthodox church in Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria. It is the third-largest church in Sofia. Plans to build a church at the site date to 1910, when Stuttgart-educated Bulgarian architect Anton Tornyov won a competition for the churchâ€™s design. Due to the Balkan Wars and World War I, however, the construction was postponed. In 1922, the church board of trustees announced another competition, which was again won by Tornyov. The construction of the Church of St Paraskeva was complete by 1930, but the finishing works on the porticos did not cease until 1940. Night view of the Church St Paraskeva has a somewhat unusual design for an Eastern Orthodox church: for example, the cella is in practice a round chamber over 20 metres in diameter. The cella gradually disintegrates into the surrounding apses.
Working Hours: \n From 7 am to 5:30 pm;
Address: Sofia,58 Rakovski blvd. (Click to see on the map)
